quoteFirst: Benton opposed it; it passed by a vote of
quoteLast: een, but was lost in the House. Clay then introduced a resolution demanding to know from the president whether the paper alleged to have been published by his authority as having been read to the cabinet, in relation to the removal of the deposits, was genuine or not; and, if it was, asking for a copy. Benton opposed the motion, which nevertheless passed.
title: Thomas Hart Benton

quoteFirst: The resolutions were, nevertheless, adopted, and by the fixed majority of
quoteLast: een, and sent to the House of Representatives for concurrence, where they met the fate which all knew they were to receive. The House did not even take them up for consideration, but continued the course which it had began at the commencement of the session; and which was in exact conformity to the legislative course, and exactly contrary to the course of the Senate.
